result.execSummary:
The defendant DeAngelo M Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. DeAngelo M Jackson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • DeAngelo M Jackson was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • DeAngelo M Jackson was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $67 VW surcharge to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  $200 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted.

Defendant is sentenced to 10 days in the Dane County Jail.  Consecutive to ct 3.  That jail term is stayed for completion of 80 hours of community service.
Consecutive to: ct 3
$67 VW surcharge to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days. Court costs remitted.

09:37 AM Defendant DeAngelo M Jackson in court with attorney Luis C Cuevas. Prosecuting Atty Robin W Lee appeared for State of Wisconsin.  

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count(s) 2, 3.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty.

Status conference on June 9, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant's attorney shall have 10 days to file an Authorization and return signed bond form. 
- Defendant shall not be at any Hampton Inn in Dane County. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)].

The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 11:30 am.
